skill.name: env-handler
skill.description: Manage environment variables securely. Handles distinction between .env (template) and .env.local (secrets).
skill.summary: Manage environment variables securely. Handles distinction between .env (template) and .env.local (s...
skill.author: AayushBaniya2006

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no code execution, file access, or network calls. Contains only documentation and best practices for secure environment variable management.

content.value_statement: Improperly managed environment variables can lead to credential leaks and security breaches. This skill provides clear guidelines for separating public templates from private secrets, ensuring sensitive data never enters version control.
actual_capabilities: Guide users on proper variable placement for sensitive data
Provide server-side and client-side variable access patterns
Define naming conventions for server secrets and public variables
Offer Vercel deployment environment variable guidance
limitations: Does not read or write actual environment files
Does not validate existing environment variable values
Does not integrate with secret management services
Does not rotate or manage API credentials

use_cases.title: Set up local development
use_cases.description: Configure secure environment variables for personal projects without risking credential exposure.

use_cases.title: Establish team conventions
use_cases.description: Create consistent environment variable patterns across team members and codebases.

use_cases.title: Prepare production deployments
use_cases.description: Structure environment configurations for Vercel and other deployment platforms.

prompt_templates.title: Add new API key
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to add a new sensitive API key for [service name]. Please guide me on where to place it in my .env files.

prompt_templates.title: Configure public variable
prompt_templates.prompt: How should I add a public configuration variable like NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_URL to my environment files?

prompt_templates.title: Review current setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Please review my current .env file structure and suggest improvements for security and organization.

prompt_templates.title: Prepare deployment
prompt_templates.prompt: I am deploying to Vercel. What environment variables do I need to configure in project settings versus .env.local?

output_examples.input: I need to add REPLICATE_API_TOKEN as a new secret
output: Add REPLICATE_API_TOKEN="" to your .env file as a template
Ask the user to add their actual token to .env.local
Never commit real tokens to version control

best_practices: Always keep .env.local git-ignored to prevent secrets from entering version control
Use empty placeholders in .env for sensitive variables that must exist in .env.local
Prefix client-side public variables with NEXT_PUBLIC_ for browser access
anti_patterns: Creating .env.example files that may accidentally contain real values
Using the same .env file for both development defaults and production secrets

faq.question: Can I use this skill with other AI coding tools?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides general guidelines applicable to any development environment.

faq.question: What are the limits on the number of variables?
faq.answer: There is no technical limit. Follow the naming conventions and keep related variables grouped for organization.

faq.question: How do I integrate with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Store secrets in your CI/CD platform's secure storage. Add non-sensitive defaults to .env and reference CI/CD variables in .env.local.

faq.question: Is my sensitive data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides guidance. It never reads, writes, or transmits your actual environment variable values.

faq.question: What if my secrets are already exposed?
faq.answer: Rotate any exposed credentials immediately. Use the skill's guidelines to restructure your files and prevent future exposure.

faq.question: How does this compare to other dotenv tools?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on file organization and security patterns rather than parsing. It complements existing dotenv libraries with best practices.
